item.description:
During the summer this trail can be quite busy, so I've decided to try a mid-morning ride. We can stop after the ride for something to eat in Ayer.

The Nashua River Rail Trail is a former railroad right of way that travels 11 miles through the towns of Ayer, Groton, Pepperell and Dunstable. For more information on this rail trail visit the following link:

http://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/northeast/nash.htm

Please note that annual dues of $5 helps to pay for the fees that meetup charges to host this group. If you have not yet had a chance to contribute, please consider doing so before the ride on this page (look to the left) or you can give me your contribution at this event and I'll make sure that it gets to Bethany our lead organizer. Thank you!
item.how_to_find_us: Nashua River Rail Trail Parking Lot in Ayer, MA
item.name: Morning Ride on the Nashua River Rail Trail
